definitions: the chemical element of atomic number 56, a soft white reactive metal of the alkaline earth group.

notes.text: Barium compounds are used in water purification, the glass industry, and pigments, and as an ingredient of signal flares and fireworks, giving a bright yellowish-green color. Barium oxide is a component of high-temperature superconductors

shortDefinitions: chemical element of atomic number 56, soft white reactive metal of alkaline earth group

definitions: a mixture of barium sulfate and water, opaque to X-rays, which is swallowed to permit radiological examination of the stomach or intestines
shortDefinitions: mixture of barium sulphate and water, opaque to X-rays
